titleStmt.title: A great fight at Chepstow Castle in the west of England, betwixt the forces under the command of Lieutenant Gen. Cromwell, and the cavaliers commanded by Sir William Kelmish, governour of the said castle, and the number slaine on both sides. Also an exact relation of the late skirmish at White-Hall upon Tuesday last, May 16. between the Parliaments forces, and the inhabitants of Surrey, with the manner of their beginning, and occasion thereof. Together with a list of the number that were slain and taken prisoners on both sides. Likewise, a great rout in Northumberland, and the full particulars thereof.
titleStmt.author: R. W.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
